definition[0]: an increase in the value of something that has been worked on, combined with other things etc so that it can be sold in a new form
example[0]: In the past, producers ignored the potential 25% added value that could be gained from selling gold as jewellery.
example[1]: Clients will look to computer systems for the answers to all legal questions, and will be willing to pay for personal service only when the added value justifies the expense.
